intro: Hedyotis tryblium, commonly known as the redroot or false pennyroyal, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects. Hedyotis tryblium thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and disturbed areas.
